source.name: Programmable Token Bridges in Cross-Chain Transactions
source.instructions: Which of the following scenarios best demonstrates a practical application of programmable token bridges in cross-chain transactions?

answers.answer: A user transfers tokens from Ethereum to Avalanche and automatically stakes them in a yield farming protocol on Avalanche in a single transaction
A user manually bridges tokens from Ethereum to Polygon, then separately interacts with a DeFi protocol on Polygon
A user views their token balances across multiple chains using a multi-chain wallet interface
A smart contract on Ethereum triggers an event that is observed by an off-chain oracle, which then initiates a transaction on Binance Smart Chain
A user swaps tokens on one chain for a different token on the same chain using a decentralized exchange

source.guidance: The correct answer is "A user transfers tokens from Ethereum to Avalanche and automatically stakes them in a yield farming protocol on Avalanche in a single transaction." This scenario demonstrates the key feature of programmable token bridges: combining token bridging with arbitrary messaging to execute a contract call on the destination chain in a single transaction. It showcases the ability to not just transfer tokens cross-chain, but also to immediately use them in a specific way (staking in this case) on the destination chain. The other options either involve separate manual steps, don't involve cross-chain transactions, or don't demonstrate the programmable aspect of modern token bridges.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT analyze and evaluate scenarios involving programmable token bridges in cross-chain transactions
